section.name: Agile Software Development / Team & Project Leadership
section.text:
Drawing from my own entrepreneurial experience, I am strongly focused on customer collaboration and delivery of concrete business value.
I have great respect for the lean/agile toolkit, and I have driven the adoption of automated testing, continuous integration, code quality visualizations, executable plain text specifications, and formal process improvement.
I balance my technical interests with creative pursuits.
I am an inspired human, and I bring this inspiration to my work and my life.

points.point: Project management emphasizing simplicity and transparency
Hub of collaboration and visibility between developers and executives
Agile development & coaching: test driven development, pair programming, etc
Continuous code integration, outputting metrics and visualizations
Lightweight just-in-time planning and scoping
Specializing in Ruby on Rails

general.strong: "Harlan is one of those too-rare people who can see what needs to be done, how to cut the problem down into bite-sized pieces, and then knock the code out of the ballpark. Both a pragmatic programmer and an agile project manager, I'd work with him again on any project that needs a guy who makes things happen!"

"Harlan is an expert agile leader and software craftsman. He is gifted at perceiving business value, establishing processes to actualize it, and leading cross-team conversations to support it. He has an impeccable personal integrity that generates good will, good results, and good luck. I value any opportunity to work with Harlan and I recommend him highly."

points.point: Making a positive impact on the world through technology
Management and executives enable, empower, and open doors
A friendly, collaborative, mutually supportive environment, with interesting and intellectually stimulating coworkers
Developing in Ruby on Rails, using RSpec, Cucumber, RubyMine, Capistrano, cruisecontrol.rb, Scriptaculous, JQuery
Extensive use of Test Driven Development, pair programming, and generally the XP/Lean/Agile toolkit
Owning and running retrospective / Kaizen meetings
Project managing: running retrospectives & planning meetings, managing scope and deadlines with visual feedback for the whole team
Developing significant new functionality for LinkedIn core website
Developing in Ruby on Rails, using Capistrano, vlad, rspec, shoulda, cruisecontrol.rb, etc
Continually bringing our focus back to business value, internally and for clients
Initiated and implemented department-wide unit testing frameworks: JUnit and CxxTest, hooked into CruiseControl

point.added: Provided technical leadership in areas of build, testing, and metrics
Managed junior developers, achieving win-win solutions from sometimes challenging situations
Integrated web application functional tests into CruiseControl (using Selenium), in an extensible manner: any number of test suites, from any variety of branches can be run on any target server

points.point: Worked with agile contractors on GWT project using Test Driven Development
Attended Agile 2007 and presented key learnings to our team

point.added: Created, estimated, categorized and prioritized internal development framework improvements, created in a lightweight, flexible task-tracking system
Strong commitment to both external and self-imposed deadlines
Attended a conference on Continuous Integration (Citcon Dallas), returning with tools for powerful visualizations of quality metrics in a given code base
Implemented unit tests utilizing Behavior Driven Development

points.point: Load testing using The Grinder, a Python-based load test recording/scripting tool
Designed and developed web and desktop applications in C#
Database design and maintenance using SQL Server, Enterprise Manager, Profiler, Query Analyzer
Maintained professional contact with Evolutia's major clients
Initiated, designed, and coded a custom error handling and reporting framework
Initiated and developed XSL-based email administration system
Coded, tested, and deployed the delicate selective import of tens of thousands of multi-frame prescription images into the live production database
Coded, tested, and deployed a system to eliminate duplicate orders from live e-commerce database
Marketed to and managed projects for a range of clients, including financial services, government agencies, training organizations, and retail ecommerce operations
C# back end coding of Camera Store Metasite

Created powerful generic "printer friendly page" generator, using C#/ASP.NET regular expressions to strip out printer-unfriendly HTML tags and attributes; created accompanying suite of unit tests and test data
Designed and coded C# desktop application to custom-mix audio files utilizing flexible XML-based configuration instructions
Coded custom raytracer from scratch using C#, including transparency, refraction index, specular highlights, and support for generic triangle mesh rendering
Unix command line operation of various remote websites
Created custom e-commerce solutions, allowing clients to add and remove custom data fields through HTML template editing
Created custom wrappers around existing C++ PDF generation libraries, for web-based generation of large PDF documents
Developed custom "email blasting" application, including extensive bounce processing facilities, written in Python, and utilizing Test-Driven Development techniques
Dynamically generated of Flash vector images based on user input, utilizing Python CGI and existing SWF generation library
Extended open source Perl shopping cart with Python business logic layer for custom e-commerce solution
Coded searchable world atlas, utilizing Python and MySQL

Developed ASP application to "screen scrape" relevant data from stock market feed using regular expressions; output of intermediate XML format, followed by XSLT conversion to XHTML and plain text versions, for final multi-format email to clients
Designed and coded basic 3D Game Engine in C++/OpenGL, using unit tests, STL, C++ best practices; implemented first person camera, motion control, BSP trees, and collision detection/response
Database-driven ASP/Access/VBA solution for tile shop, showcasing extensive image catalog, including industry-leading cross-browser JavaScript online tile visualization application
Designed and coded Flash/PHP/MySQL ski resort booking system, using Test Driven Development
Created customized e-commerce solutions for products and course sales, using commercial ASP shopping cart
Implemented extensive customizations to ASP/HTML/JavaScript forum software
Designed and coded Java desktop app to generate on the fly tutorials from XML instruction sets
Flexibility
Enthusiasm
Lateral thinking
High degree of motivation
Organized, focussed, strive for zero backlog
Desire to make luminous software experiences
Not fixed on my own ideas; always open to change when a superior solution is available
I think carefully about interface design, not just from the developer's point of view, but from the user's
A balanced human with a social life, a love of art and theater, yoga, and meditation, as well as cutting edge technology
Inspired about software best practices, like eliminating code duplication; building simple, rapid prototypes; rigorous automated testing
I try to be as awake as possible in all areas of my life. At work this means: taking ownership where appropriate; questioning assumptions; lateral thinking; openness to unexpected directions

point.trainingType: Implementing Lean Software Development: Practitioner's course
point.trainingDetails: Mary & Tom Poppendieck, New York NY, 2008

point.trainingType: Edward Tufte: Presenting Data and Information
CitCon - Continuous Integration and Testing Conference
Bachelor of Science, Computer Science (First Class Honors)

points.point: Computer graphics submajor: 3D game engine in C++/OpenGL, raytracer in C# (1.0 beta)
Extreme Programming course, including hands-on industry experience
Cisco Networking Certification
Collaborative creativity systems
Systems for sharing trust ratings -- of corporations, politicians, etc
Visual programming languages
Intelligence amplification, transhumanism, technological singularity
4D Tetris

testimonialText.general: Harlan is a very competent project manager. He is detail oriented and doesn't let anything fall through the cracks. He is proactive in getting his people together to have those tough conversations. Harlan is very much an advocate of transparency and is able to report the appropriate level of information to the right people, so they in turn can stay on the pulse of the project. Harlan has been fantastic to work with and I would be honored to work with him on a project again.

testimonial.testimonialText:
Harlan's positive and friendly attitude combined with his experience with agile development practices make him a great team member on critical, time-sensitive projects. As a developer, his decision making process always focuses first on delivering business value, and keeping the team on track to
deliver quality, tested software.
He introduced many agile practices at Wireless Generation, leading the creation of the infrastructure and test cases for automated web acceptance tests. Aware of the challenges faced in
introducing change,
Harlan created
highly visible project metrics
to keep product owners constantly informed of story progress and code quality. His friendly personality and creative energy always made pairing sessions fun, and I'd welcome the chance to work with him again.
testimonial.testimonialUnedited: Harlan's positive and friendly attitude combined with his experience with agile development practices make him a great team member on critical, time-sensitive projects. As a developer, his decision making process always focuses first on delivering business value, and keeping the team on track to deliver quality, tested software. He introduced many agile practices at Wireless Generation, leading the creation of the infrastructure and test cases for automated web acceptance tests. Aware of the challenges faced in introducing change, Harlan created highly visible project metrics to keep product owners constantly informed of story progress and code quality. His friendly personality and creative energy always made pairing sessions fun, and I'd welcome the chance to work with him again.

testimonialText.general: Harlan was a progressive force in the company, promoting agile practices and
testimonialText.attention: helping us improve the way we made software
testimonialText.general: . Harlan quickly developed an automated build process; In retrospect I don't know how we got by without an automated build. He set up code metrics, promoted unit tests, and a concern for developing high quality software. More than anything, Harlan brings a
testimonialText.attention: passion for developing software the right way

testimonial.testimonialUnedited: I worked with Harlan for about 18 months at Wireless Generation. During that time Harlan was a progressive force in the company, promoting agile practices and helping us improve the way we made software. Harlan quickly saw the need for and developed an automated build process. In retrospect I don't know how we got by without an automated build, but at the time there was some skepticism. He set up code metric and other tools. He promoted unit tests and a concern for developing high quality software in a modern sense. And of course he producing high quality applications. More than anything, Harlan brings a passion for developing software the right way.

testimonialText.attention: intelligence, professionalism, talent and genuine interest in software development
testimonialText.general: not to mention his warmth, wit, and consideration for others - make him an excellent developer, and a pleasure to work with. His
testimonialText.attention: considered, lateral and focused approach to his work is a true asset,
testimonialText.general: as is his ability to communicate very effectively. We were sad to see him leave to return to the US. I have no hesitation in recommending Harlan to any organization seeking a developer, and person, of very high quality.

testimonial.testimonialUnedited: Harlan's intelligence, professionalism, talent and genuine interest in software development - not to mention his warmth, wit, and consideration for others - make him an excellent developer, and a pleasure to work with. His considered, lateral and focused approach to his work is a true asset, as is his ability to communicate very effectively. We were sad to see him leave to return to the US. I have no hesitation in recommending Harlan to any organisation seeking a developer, and person, of very high quality.

testimonialText.attention: one of the most intelligent and talented people I have taught in 24 years
testimonialText.general: of teaching at UTS. He studied a number of my computer graphics electives, where he was an enthusiastic and imaginative student with outstanding programming abilities. Harlan is an outstanding person who is friendly, outgoing, and articulate. You should grab him before somebody else does.

testimonial.testimonialUnedited: Harlan is one of the most intelligent and talented people I have taught in 24 years of teaching at UTS. He studied a number of my computer graphics electives, where he was an enthusiastic and imaginative student with outstanding programming abilities. But it wasn't only in computer graphics that Harlan excelled; his academic record demonstrates how he excelled across a wide range of information technology areas. He is also an experienced web developer with experience running his own company. Harlan is an outstanding person who is friendly, outgoing, and articulate. He would make an excellent employee. You should grab him before somebody else does.
